text:
Twitter was so integral to president
Trump's campaign it gave him an

opportunity to really reach out to these
supporters and energize them but always

seen in the White House is that it's
undercut some of the message that his

top aides would like him to carry out
obviously on Saturday many Republicans

were let down when he didn't condemn
white nationalists and the KKK and it's

alright groups then it came out
yesterday and obviously made that

statement some said it was a little too
little too late but just hours after

that he got on Twitter and began sending
these messages that really undercut what

he said he first attacked the media
saying that we would never be satisfied

with his with his answers then the
following morning he retweets a known

conspiracy theorist who raised questions
about why the media wasn't more outraged

with other shootings and is focused on
this Charlottesville violence and then

just this morning and this is something
we've seen from the president number of

times he retweeted an image of a train
hitting a person who had a CNN logo on

the top of their head and now obviously
this is reminiscent of past weeks the

president has sent about CNN that
wrestling tweet they got so much

attention a few months ago but really
these Twitter missives have really

undercut the president's message that he
tried to send on Monday and make it

difficult for people to believe that he
is being honest and genuine when he

comes out and said what he said from the
White House yesterday
